column5: Could this be the start of a really bad thing?  NR-confirmGrasscarp.pdf
They figure it was sterile and intentionally released to control weeds?
According to this CBC report, studies have confirmed it is sterile: http://www.cbc.ca/news/technology/story/2013/05/03/kitchener-grass-carp-grand-river.html
Just so we are clear... Grass carp and Asian carp ARE different....   There was a grass carp caught on the st Lawrence a few years ago...
I don't think they are as bad...

Grass carp eat plankton and algae like asian carp, but dont jump in schools and kill boaters. They really wouldn't be all that bad to have around.. but its never good to introduce a new species to an environment.
